content:
It is difficult to determine the exact impact of advertising campaigns on sales, as many factors can influence consumer behavior. However, it is safe to say that the success of Pontiac's marketing campaigns likely played a role in influencing consumer perceptions and driving sales, especially in the short term.

For example, the "Pontiac Excitement" campaign by D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles ran for over a decade and was credited with helping to revitalize the Pontiac brand during that time. Similarly, the launch campaign for the Pontiac G6 by Leo Burnett helped to change consumer perceptions of the brand and attracted a new, younger audience.

While it is difficult to quantify the exact impact of these campaigns on sales, it is clear that they were successful in generating buzz around the brand and creating a positive image for Pontiac among consumers. This, in turn, would likely have had a positive impact on sales, at least in the short term.

It is worth noting, however, that Pontiac eventually went out of business in 2010 due to a variety of factors, including the decline of the American auto industry, changing consumer preferences, and a lack of investment by General Motors. The success of these campaigns alone was not enough to save the brand.
